name: David Marler
text: this place is great enough just on pricing .but its so great to go to a place and they show there belief in the lord by there actions and the way they treat others. my metal for my house was so unreliable cheap but they treated me like I was a very important customer .I was amazed. and will never shop anywhere else or recommend

name: Sonya Buchanan
text: Undecided on what color metal I wanted for my new roof, Zack offered to mail me a samples to help me decide. Fast shipping and great customer service helping me decide and pay over the phone. I appreciate the kindness and respectful tone he presented to a undecided first time homeowner. Thank you Zack!

name: Debora McCutcheon
text: Do not do business with the guys!!! They take your money and don’t finish the job!!! We’ve been waiting over a year now. And they will not respond to phone calls.  Terrible customer service!!

resp.text: Deborah, My name is Zac Smith and I am the owner of Agcor. Please call me at the office on Monday. I have never heard of you before but I will be glad to see what the issue is. My personal email address is zsmith@agcorsteel.com. I am sure I can get to the bottom of it in a few minutes.

name: Innovative Fence Solutions Cullman, AL
text: Great place to deal with. Best prices around and good customer service.

name: Tim Chambers
text: Great working environment and great benefits.

name: Robert allan
text: It’s sad to see an Company that shows favoritism as well as neglect To OSHA rules as well they Have machines that Leak oil no lights on them no safety guards an well say your the on safe one here

name: Evan Brock
text: Great place to do business. Owners are great people and they'll get you what you need.

name: Kevin Gaskin
text: Great group of people, easy going to get unloaded

name: shawn hudson
text: First time customer, shorted one sheet called and told them I would be there the next day to pick up.  Was told it would be ready by Zack, the owner.  Got there the next day and material was not ready, waited 30 minutes to get it cut.  Climb up on the roof to finish my job only to find the sheet is 3 inches too long.  Not the best experience.   The quality of the metal was good, service, Not so much.

name: James Glimpse
text: outstanding products. Agcor Steel produces top grade steel buildings. We are working to build a shop with living quarters. A dream come true.

name: Dean Mangum
text: They built a pole barn for me. They did everything they said they would...and more. Good folks to deal with.

name: Vinemont Welding
text: Great people and great pricing

name: Dike Moss
text: Best place in Cullman to get metal roofing and complete pole barn kits.   Price and quality are tops here.

name: Lone Wolf
text: I picked up a preloaded trailer here in the middle of the night. The guard was a cool guy and the place was a ghost town just like I like it!! No problems at all.

name: Ron Geist
text: Unload was fast, but the reload not so much. 2 hours 45 mins and 3 trucks that have come in after me are already loaded. Last time I was here they were quicker ar loading.

name: Ravdeep Bhinder
text: Worst company ever they took 8 hours for loading! Slowest workers, they don’t want to work, don’t come here

name: Pargat Sandhu
text: No no no i  am never ever come back pick up here OMG 7+hr waiting for pick up , broker no pay waiting time ,if you want to pick up here steel plates make sure you have food otherwise tummy hurts,no stars 👎👎👎👎👎

name: Jamrock Trucker
text:
This place is not for owner Ops nor lease Ops. These people have no respect for time so if you are a time oriented driver stay away from this place. They'll have you sitting for 6+ hours to get loaded while other drivers who checked in after you get loaded before you. The only loading area that shows respect for time is 226..... I HATE THIS PLACE

One hour later and I'm still sitting by bay 6 waiting to get called in after I got the text to pull up to the door.

Important note: MAKE SURE YOU HAVE FOOD ON YOUR TRUCK BEFORE YOU COME HERE!

name: Chestii Prin SUA
text:
4 years ago I left a one star review because there is no Receiving hours on Google map, now still the same. But I can fix it for you ;)

7am to 3:30PM

I was unloaded fast, and luckily the main storeroom building is before the main gates, so you don't have to drive 20 minutes to find a building.

Update: there is overnight parking I guess, around 15 of them right before the entrance.

name: Amrik Singh
text: Driver o/o whoever u are.. avoid this place if u have a option.. or be ready to spend all your HOS waoting here to be loaded..people leaving to reviews are mostly drivers working on drop switch work.. live loading sucks.. u have to waot for a text and while waiting u can sleep or relax as a text can come anytime

name: Tracey Hawkins
text: Drop and hook so no waiting. Guard at the gate was so nice and friendly.

name: tom Overstreet
text: 17 hours load time

name: John Chestnut
text: This place is the slowest mill I've ever been to. Hell you can go right down the road to and get a load within half the time of ssab. At least a 2he wait EVERY TIME but on a normal basis it's about a 3 to 4hr wait!! Horrible everytime

name: Andrei Kaplunov
text:
Delivery hours 7am-2.30pm, no appointments needed(no chances after 3pm, do not try)

Pick ups 7am-10pm (for now, previously was 24/7) FCFS - sometimes you have to wait for a few hours, sometimes 30 min
Overall good people

name: PS PS
text: Appointment at 12 o'clock noon I didn't get out of there in till 8:00 p.m.. Of course it's an oversize load and no night driving so the entire day was shot. Nobody cares because its the truck driver losing out . Not SSAB OR THE TRUCKING COMPANY.  These people could care less if you are DEAD in your truck.  No break Room no snacks no food but they do supply you with a filthy porta potty and expects you to stay there the entire day. Negative 10 stars

name: ORLANDO REESE
text: Look if you trying to get loaded and leave.  Well you can give it up the employees will load a trailer and it will take two hours per truck.  And it be seven trucks in line.    But the drop and hook is better.         You have been warn👹👹👹👹👹

And must say their traffic dispatcher is a word class Pinocchio lies like he breathes,from broken crane to broken printer anything goes. Never again not even if they were last ones on earth to do business with.

text: Best 3 1/2 hours of Labor Day Friday...Lost. Left empty handed. 3rd rate operation on the shipping side of it. O/O OTR DRIVERS, give this one a miss unless you want to eat up your clock. Better luck next door at Calvert.

name: Kyle Smith
text: Slowest shipper I’ve ever been to. They really need new management in the shipping department 6 hours still not loaded. No bathrooms just hot nasty Johnny on the spot. Better bring you some food!! And long sleeves really it’s like 110* F inside the buildings.

name: Tracey Hawkins
text: Waiting in staging for 7 hours before getting to a door. Got out of there at 11:40pm got there about 1:30pm. Live loads are the worst especially when the guys loading are moving so slow you feel like you're going in reverse.

name: Kruzifer Delaluz
text: These guys are fantastic. They can always get what you need. Even if it isn't in stock in Mobile, they can get it in a day from the Ryerson in Birmingham, Atlanta or New Orleans. Guys in the shop are friendly and always willing to help. This is the only company I will ever buy metal from.

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to leave a review Kruzifer Delaluz. Hope to see you back

1,5-2 hours.

name: Micael S
text: I'm a TMC driver I met Mack today 4-8-20. he allowed me to park here overnight they have medium size yard but can turn around easy in. Look at the picks bay 12 is where the crain is to offload Rebar in are pics.

resp.text: Hi Micael, thanks for the great rating and feedback. It’s always our goal to make sure people who come through our facility are taken care of as efficiently and safely as possible. We’re glad to hear you had a positive experience! Thanks again, and we’ll see you next time. Drive safe.

name: Tyler Sims
text: I drove truck for them about 6 months. Decent company. The pay isn't good for the work and risk you deal with and some people don't pull their weight. The GM and people in office were really cool. The guy over trailers acted like every came out of his pocket. Good company for rookie or someone wanting to dip their toes in flatbedding but not a good career choice

name: KathyWilker GoogleAcct
text: The office manager does All of her personal business on company time...unless shes on one of her 20+ breaks for the day..  Covers up a lot of mistakes.  Even big ones like tax mess ups... for one, didnt meet the deadline one year.. because she was showing her house on company time for weeks.  Totally forgot avout taxes...don't know how she fixed that one...but she waa good at cover ups!

name: Anthony Barnard
text: 1 star is too much one of the sorriest places I've ever delivered.

text:
Their local driver needs to go back to driving school.!!  Must have  found a license in a crackerjackbox.
Enough said.

name: Scotty Preston
text: Dont ever ever ever ever take a load coming to this place. They are lazy and dont care. They will not pay detention. I was here 6 hours and was 4th inline smi. I h OP pe everyone sees this and stops accepting frieght here. The only way to punish these people is if the trucks stop coming.

name: Matthew Van Norman
text: The customer service provided by Henry at the L & W Supply in Mobile, AL has been beyond exceptional.  He goes above and beyond to take care of his customers. Go see him at their store here in Mobile for any of your drywall, insulation and roofing materials. You will not be disappointed.

name: David Puzar
text: Need to arrive before 8 am to get offloaded quicker.  Public has proirity. Staff was accondating and worked dilegently to do the best they could.

name: Deanna Odom
text: I can’t say enough about L&W especially Henry! He was there anytime to help solve any problems and he and his guys made it happen. I wish other sale reps were that concerned about their customers at all businesses! Thanks again Henry

name: Daniel Deyette
text: Friendly folks, fast and easy load. Excellent experience.

name: clay morse
text: Not open 😕

name: Deann Roten
text: We needed some metal roofing for a chicken pen was able to get some damage 3ft by10ft for $18 a sheet. Was able to use them .

name: SV Jones
text:
I called them today and asked about the availability of a product. I was transferred to a salesman. After I explained what I needed, he repeated three times: we have (name of product). No more, no less. I was not encouraged to ask any more questions about the product he named. He then advised me to check Google, and after I did that, to call back and tell them whether what they had was what I needed.
I was driving, so I pulled over and Googled the product he mentioned. It looked good, so I called back. He was on the phone so I drove over to the business.
A gentleman with a radio met me outside and was very cordial. He called the same salesman on the radio and, per my request, asked what the price was. I could clearly overhear the salesman on the other end.
He said "we have to get these customers to start calling in." He stated the price, then asked for my name and I gave it. He asked if it would be cash and I relayed that it would be my debit card. He could not find my name in the system (I have done light business there in the past and last time my name was in the system.) He then told the gentleman on the radio that I was not in the system and would have to call in my order and credit card information, then I could come back and buy the single item that I needed.
I left and found the product I needed at a steel supply in Montgomery.
I'm not a huge commercial contractor, and I don't represent much money to these businesses. But I'm still a prospective customer. I have always had a great and pleasant experience at Alabama Steel, pre-Covid and during Covid. Today was .not typical but it sure made me feel that it didn't matter if I took my money elsewhere. Kudos to the outside sales guy, though.
But there is a silver lining: because of this negative experience,  I found an alternate steel business which displays professionalism, great customer skills and makes me feel valued, no matter how small my purchase may be. I spent my career in customer-oriented businesses, and if I have to drive a few more miles to receive good customer service, then that is where my money will go.

name: Ann Sheppard
text: The young man who helped me was very nice and patient with me and I really appreciated that.

name: Tommy8mbnhb Thu Hz Mcgough

text: They are slow they don't have there product stage for the amount of trucks that come through there because us truck drivers work on limited time we be there so long until we run out of hours to drive.  Need to work on there staging abilities Company need to have the workers do better than they are Thank you

name: K
text: Place is a joke 4 am appt didn't leave till after 9 am. Every one stands around jerking each other off. Should never take this long to get loaded with as many people they have working/standing around. Never coming back.

name: mundy Musgrove
text: Terrible place to load. And if you run out of hours. They do not allow overnight parking.

name: Michael Clark
text: Great place to work!!

name: kevin black
text: This place only gets 3 stars from me. The loads pay really good but it takes forever to get loaded. The staff doesn't take your time serious. They spend entirely too much time socializing about personal agendas, or any and everything except getting the steel loaded and getting the trucks underway.

name: Neil Roden
text: Worst place in alabama to wotk they create jobs for their children in the office. The women in the office well if they moved up they spent a lot of time on their knees. All of the supervisors were from fyffe and think one of those space ships landed and thats who these supervisors are because they act like their from another planet. It you are planning on working there get ready to pucker up because thats how you move up especially the female managers. I was one of the workers that made it a great place to work with some of the other old hand as they called us worst head manager and safety  coordinator. I have ever met. And as for my shipping supervisor he.s about like a helicopter mom he had no confidence or balls. I.m actually putting it nicely if you want to work there you are going to get what you ask for. Try to get on in the shop much better quality of people than outside.had a couple of guys called their selfs preachers well if their preachers i would hate to know how they would act if they were just average joes they never .helped anyone but their selfs and also watch out for the back stabbers out on the yard thats all thats their hope to run into one of the soon.

name: Mark Collins
text: Although I have never been to any facility of Vulcraft/Nucor, My son (Alex Smith) works in the New York plant and has been for about two years now. I hear a lot of great opportunities with awesome benefits and great work ethics. He tells me almost daily about his day and what the accomplishments get done. I know he gets excited when there are orders that come in because he says he feels proud that he can be on a team that produces the joists. I myself have always been in sales along with Retail management as store manager and assistant to district manager, but I also owned my business as a wholesale distributor in the exhaust industry. But managing and sales are my specialty. One day I hope to take a tour of one of your plants. Thank your for keeping the steel industry in the USA.

name: Rana Bha
text:
IN/OUT Fast
Metal deliveries in door at south east corner from the entrance follow dirt road and watch for tight turns.

name: Jamey Grammer
text: Not good for truck drivers. The receiving guy also has other duties besides trucks and you will wait til he gets time to unload you. The only down time they care about is their own.

name: T Ray
text: It was nice meeting with the staff
